intro: Pecluma alfredii var. cupreolepis, commonly known as the copperleaf plant, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves, which are usually elliptical and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Pecluma alfredii var. cupreolepis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
